FD62EDF0F4CB4DB58C65462517A07BA3.description: Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion); use formal English when appropriate to task and situation.

176FA4EC80404FD4846A66C71282C82D.description: Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

53CC322408424CF4AD2F47A6D3EE9E30.description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

7BACD2FC12884E52A0A95BFD6333102E.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

BF948F4BE93840659418C4939E61BAC4.description: Paraphrase portions of a text or information presented in a variety of media and formats.

7E3CFC2607BC42E4A4F3911DEBEDB91E.description: Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

C6BC6DF9471745F3B57817C00E0D28CB.description: Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

12DB3A1EDB6046DAAC3392B7A35258A5.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

159C083A37F24AA391DEDDB39B96AC88.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with a variety of partners on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

743422A0C682499E99B69412FA5B69D7.description: Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

61010C80609342198669258D7B862D51.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

98C860938C894F81B70D9A7028A45E8A.description: Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

83590627B48F4395867C71AC7268DFC0.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships, and nuances in word meanings within the context of 4th grade text. Clarification: the terminology of figurative language is introduced.

E25AFC0F2CE84936B524A953F47EF60F.description: Use dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses, both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

DC75019B1BF94402A4A827FBC0AC551F.description: Use common Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word; i.e. telegraph, photograph, autograph.

286BCF744B234E3D9A6B3152F45B1964.description: Use definitions, examples, or restatements in text as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase. Clarification: defines context clue

B232C68024BD4D988C18DAA62CA93C72.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

DFAD1A3463494755BF058AE78E65ED1D.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

8B7121651BB04A6AA206315DCF75C21A.description: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.

25DE5A3C739D4469B28296C4633B1859.description: Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.

4BB5E41EB5514368AE821866E91B52D8.description: Demonstrate mastery of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

DFFA33F4F45249AFAAD04ACD32D9A590.description: Correctly use frequently misused homophones (e.g., to, too, two; there, their). Clarification 1: order of adjectives: opinion, size, age, shape, color, origin, material, purpose.

88161550C90D482680B5E24DEF8B97FA.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

E3AC6B797B7546AF939883566A5F95BD.description: Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag)

D3DD3A8F34934C6C9BC35546800EF95B.description: Use modal auxiliaries ("helping verbs") e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

AB52E9227D0B40F2A345F5956F6235BA.description: Use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.

55CE03F8E6084245812CD12587357532.description: Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).

4733AB5A265943E292570052A0C71857.description: Use conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

81769625792C4B979A806E92EF61AC7D.description: Students will be able to write two five sentence paragraphs, including a introductory paragraph and a supporting body paragraph on a topic that uses supportive detail, correct capitalization, end punctuation and transitional words.

5446028A8D824BEE93C1320AA4D545C0.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences  including for enjoyment and self-expression..

2427155CE06E4D69A45C9632F780E45A.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. Clarification 1: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions].”). Clarification 2: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text”).

B9C3C04980434C829A3B55A8AD3E7409.description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.

0EC510B5D48448128AE6BEED663B510E.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic. Clarification 1: Teachers should guide appropriate use of search terms and process in using search engines; i.e. Google.

AA50A3A62EDF4196A66A62EDE21EFDBA.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

E03DA435DB824F9497EFBFFFD7D35AB6.description: Students will use technology tools, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

EB61DDAF5F25463FB2E44BF8FD433F62.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

A90B37FB10044001A55BFC9E5F4905B6.description: Write a two paragraph narrative to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. Clarification 1: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally. Clarification 2: Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations. Clarification 3: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events. Clarification 4: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely. Clarification 5: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

8F34C4A4E9CA43C9B1E51673F84D9EF7.description: Write a two paragraph informative or explanatory piece to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly. Clarification 1: Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension. (Introductory paragraph). Clarification 2: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic. (Body paragraph). Clarification 3: Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because). Clarification 4: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic. Clarification 5:  Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

5F6EE866CBC74579950106936A8EEE9F.description: Write a two paragraph opinion piece on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information. Clarification 1: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer’s purpose. (Introductory paragraph). Clarification 2: Use a variety of sentence types to link opinion and elaborate on reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition). (Body paragraph). Clarification 3: Provide a concluding statement related to the opinion presented.

D47F5A32153E4DAF8671DE6CBC4C33FC.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry at the 4 grade level.

3C1C6C11C5584EEFAFBD1A4F157763F7.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

100FF2C2E27345968BECCEEA9F058FF8.description: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

8154E64D8D664BEC9D9D7FF033CB2E27.description: Compare and contrast the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the same text, identifying where each form reflects specific descriptions and details in the text.

83792DD0DC714860B05785225F340312.description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories told, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

6BFC70F081AA4A759DB8E7269989B19B.description: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

CE6C57BC09C04892BEC48C969058BA8A.description: Determine the unique meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including but not limited to science, social studies, and religion.

7B802DCF57B4437F8586412FCB94BA39.description: Summarize a known text in three or four sentences highlighting main idea and key details verbally and in writing.

F33E65B2AFC942349478D70695D8594E.description: Explain what the text says explicitly and draw inferences from the text using specific details and examples from the text

4425B090B5A64BB2B3F99081CC87773C.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text.

502F60DF3DD94B909721E8D2F19D0AA7.description: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions).

C9E213639132443D987639F02B317BEA.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the 4 grade level text complexity, independently and proficiently.

57D9F0D57E6F42989BF5B2AB61E045CD.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A0616F270B1B4E029D5CFFADC3E50051.description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

1FDAE2C7702643A9AFB5B8ACDD044C23.description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

E2B2AF0170684E4D8B761BC175EA5B41.description: Explain how an author uses details and evidence to support main ideas in a text.

6D6A6ABE3C1B4505ACE4F1A35E86E19F.description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

F91534A071D14BB197A2FC297C2F99A1.description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in the information provided.

3F67E8914840499CBB99433FC24FFA1C.description: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

357F7049B9BD42AA853397AB317CFD01.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

F5FF868EDF4E48EEB16FDC411D728C4A.description: Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details.

F55C8B59999F4BB99F3D9F47EBDAFC15.description: Explain what the text says by refering to details and examples in the text.

C166AC12D181470786AFBFFC9CC6A1E2.description: Students will be able to fluently read connected text at a rate of 133 Words Correct Per Minute (WCPM) with greater than 96% accuracy (50th percentile).  For the purpose of fluency, the End-of-Year target was derived from range of researched-based high-frequency word list including Dibels.

93165B8DB9464122B94CC8FF1FE037D3.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

73EC4F1D27B54021933EA1E0F5775912.description: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

2DAA1C364DFC4BD8869E716BAD825BDA.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

61BFF7DAC0C248A79C3ABDC4D0A44639.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

4A9C7B0D4C57423A8F7ADDE52827BA70.description: Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multi-syllabic words in context and out of context and in application.

582F2F8271FC48B0BE0649399383EBB6.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
